alert.note: Alert for Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nassau, central Baker and south central Charlton Counties through 1030 AM EST... At 1000 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sanderson, or 18 miles north of Raiford, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Taylor, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, St. George, Sanderson and Bryceville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
